critical_findings.title: .env file is tracked in git repository
critical_findings.description: The .env file containing secrets is committed to git. This exposes sensitive credentials in version history.
critical_findings.risk: All secrets in .env are exposed in git history and visible to anyone with repository access
remediation: Remove .env from git history: git rm --cached .env && git commit
Rotate ALL secrets that were committed (JWT_SECRET, SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY, AWS keys, etc.)
Use environment variables in Vercel dashboard for production

high_findings.title: 113 files contain sensitive keywords
high_findings.description: Many API files reference passwords, tokens, secrets, and API keys. Manual review needed to ensure no hardcoded secrets.
remediation: Audit all 113 files for hardcoded secrets
Add pre-commit hook to scan for secrets

medium_findings.title: No secret scanning in CI/CD
medium_findings.description: No automated secret scanning tool detected in the repository
remediation: Add pre-commit hooks for secret detection
Run regular scans in CI pipeline
